meanings.definition: To add too much sauce to something.
meanings.sent1: She kept oversaucing her pasta until it was swimming in tomato sauce.
meanings.sent2: I always oversauce my salads, making them soggy and unappetizing.
meanings.sent3: The chef's oversaucing of the steak turned it into a soup instead of a meal.
meanings.sent4: His oversaucing of the conversation with jokes made it hard to take him seriously.
meanings.sent5: The children's oversaucing of the playground with laughter filled the air with joy.

meanings.definition: The act of putting an excessive amount of sauce on food.
meanings.sent1: Her oversaucing of the spaghetti made it impossible to taste anything but the marinara.
meanings.sent2: The oversaucing of the burger with ketchup made it a messy delight to eat.
meanings.sent3: The oversaucing of the pizza with cheese was a gooey disaster waiting to happen.
meanings.sent4: The oversaucing of the ice cream with toppings turned it into a sugary mountain.
meanings.sent5: The oversaucing of the sandwich with mustard created a tangy explosion in every bite.
